intro: Neisandra indica, commonly known as the Indian neisandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries. Neisandra indica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
